column4: Microsoft discriminated against women in pay  promotions: U.S. lawsuit
column5: Microsoft Corp  on Wednesday was hit with a proposed class action lawsuit in U.S. court claiming its policy of ranking employees to determine pay and promotions led to discrimination against women.

column4: Microsoft discriminated against women in pay  promotions -U.S. lawsuit
column5: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday was hit with a proposed class action lawsuit in U.S. court claiming its policy of ranking employees to determine pay and promotions led to discrimination against women.

column4: Microsoft discriminated against women in pay  promotions -U.S. lawsuit
column5: Sept 16 Microsoft Corp on Wednesday was hit with a proposed class action lawsuit in U.S. court claiming its policy of ranking employees to determine pay and promotions led to discrimination against women.

column4: Apple faces hurdles as it positions iPad Pro for business use
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc. faces significant challenges selling its larger and more powerful iPad Pro to businesses because companies are reluctant to switch software vendors and use an expensive device that lacks specialized business apps  analysts said.

column4: Cisco router break-ins bypass cyber defenses
column5: FRANKFURT (Company corrects the 15th paragraph beginning "The malicious programme..." to clarify that the nickname SYNful refers to the signal routers sent to open up communication with other routers  rather than how the implanted software jumps between routers.)

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Cisco router break-ins bypass cyber defences
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 15 Security researchers say they have uncovered clandestine attacks across three continents on the routers that direct traffic around the Internet  potentially allowing suspected cyberspies to harvest vast amounts of data while going undetected.
